answers.answer: Dopomoha is a web support and information platform designed for migrants fleeing the war in Ukraine.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/about and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: Dopomoha provides information on entry requirements at the border, asylum procedures in Romania, rights and obligations of asylum seekers, and useful resources for their stay.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/about and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: Dopomoha assists migrants fleeing the war in Ukraine, specifically all displaced migrants in Romania.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/about and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: People can access Dopomoha through a browser from any device.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/about and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: Dopomoha supports Romanian, Ukrainian, English, and Russian languages.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/about and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: Dopomoha's information is updated regularly with verified information from official sources.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/about and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: Dopomoha was created by Code for Romania in partnership with the Department for Emergency Situations (DSU), The UN Refugee Agency, International Organization for Migration (OIM), and the National Romanian Council for Refugees (CNRR).
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/about and read the page carefully.
